committee.name: Health, Employment, Labor, and Pensions Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health, Employment, Labor, and Pensions.
Referred to House Education and the Workforce

Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Education and the Workforce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to House Ways and Means

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: By Ms. LINDA T. SANCHEZ of California:H.R. 3118.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8____________________[Page H5589]

item.name: Health, Employment, Labor, and Pensions Subcommittee

item.text:
Strengthening Social Security Act of 2013 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to prescribe special rules for the determination of taxable wages and self-employment income above the contribution and benefit base after 2013.

Amends SSA title II to include surplus average indexed monthly earnings (AIME) in the determination of primary OASDI amounts.

Directs the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) of the Department of Labor to prepare and publish the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers (CPI-EC) that indicates changes over time in expenditures for consumption which are typical for individuals in the United States who have attained early retirement age for purposes of an old-age, wife's, or husband's insurance benefit.

Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) (OASDI) of the Social Security Act to make the CPI-EC the applicable Consumer Price Index (CPI) for computation of cost-of-living increases in OASDI benefits for such individuals.
item.name: Introduced in House

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.title: To improve the retirement security of American families by strengthening Social Security.

bill.title: Strengthening Social Security Act of 2013

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health, Employment, Labor, and Pensions.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
